The vvise-woman of Hogsdon A comedie. As it hath been sundry times acted with great applause. Written by Tho: Heyvvood. Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
[72] p.
Printed by M. P[arsons] for Henry Shephard, and are to be sold at his shop in Chancerie-Lane, at the signe of the Bible, between Serjeants-Inne and Fleet-street, London : 1638.
Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-I⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
